description: Forces Claude to evaluate design engineering skills before proceeding with any task. Based on Scott Spence's forced eval pattern (84% activation vs 20% baseline).

UserPromptSubmit.prompt:
MANDATORY SKILL EVALUATION — Complete before ANY implementation.

Step 1 — EVALUATE each skill against this prompt:

  problem-definition: Does this involve raw client input, meeting notes, call feedback, figuring out what the problem is, reframing, or "help me understand what we're solving"? User pasting notes from a call?
  -> YES / NO (reason)

  design-context: Does this involve a new/unfamiliar codebase, missing design documentation, understanding existing design decisions, generating a DESIGN.md, or bridging design context gaps?
  -> YES / NO (reason)

  design-engineering: Does this involve starting a project, auditing UI/UX, design tokens, design systems, visual assets, information architecture, navigation structure, component architecture, interaction design, states and transitions, Nielsen heuristics, Double Diamond, or design QA?
  -> YES / NO (reason)

Step 2 — ACTIVATE: For each YES, use Skill(skill-name) NOW before proceeding.

Step 3 — IMPLEMENT: Only after activation, proceed with the task.

Note: The 21 Design Bible skills (core-principles, typography, colors, etc.) are handled by Claude's native skill matching via their description frontmatter. Only the 3 process skills above need explicit evaluation.

CRITICAL: The evaluation is WORTHLESS unless you ACTIVATE matching skills. Do NOT skip to implementation. If problem-definition is YES, do NOT suggest solutions or designs — only help define problems.
